emuInput.TitMainTitle: Wrecked 1949 model car driven by Norman R. Allen, with crumpled front end and dents on rear and passenger side, parked in lot with warehouse building in background
emuInput.CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 23, 1955, pg. 1, reads: "Crash Kills One - A two-car collision at Frankstown and Lang Avenues early Saturday morning, killed 17-year-old Harold Scott of 7373 Lemington Avenue, Penn Township, and seriously injured Norman R. Allen, 20, right, inset, of 1 East Lemington Avenue, also of Penn Township, and Thomas H. Croom, 27, left inset, of 2600 Wylie Avenue. The latter two were drivers of the cars which crashed into a confectionary store.  Upper photo, the car Allen was driving...Both cars were completely wrecked, police said. - Harris Photo."
